xxl.core.pipes.operators
Class AbstractPipe<I,O>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.operators.AbstractPipe<I,O>
Type Parameters:
I - type of the incoming objects
O - type of the outgoing objects
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pipe<I,O>, Node, Sink<I>, Source<O>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractBufferPipe, AbstractTimeStampPipe, Aggregator, Counter, Filter, HeapSorter, IdentityPipe, IndexJoin, Join, Mapper, MultiWayEquiJoin, PredicateSorter, Union
public abstract class AbstractPipe<I,O>
extends AbstractNode
implements Pipe<I,O>

Superclass for each kind of internal operators in a query graph. Abstract implementation of the interface Pipe, which extens the interfaces Source and Sink.
A pipe consists of two parts: a sink where the elements stream in and get processed and a source, which transfers the results to all subscribed sinks. Note: The dataflow is aligned from the inital sources of a query graph to its terminal sinks as usual. But the controlflow may vary. Sometimes the calls start from a terminal sink and end by the initial sources, e.g., in the case of an open call. But during a done call the direction is contrary.
Forwarding method calls in both directions within a query graph lead to a very complex architecture that combines the advantages of data-driven and demand-driven processing. The facts that the initial autonomous sources of a query graph use threads simulating their activity, even other pipes start further threads with regard to their processing and concurrently terminal sinks (like graphical user interfaces etc.) may run in own threas requires that synchronisation aspects become very important, because a pipe can be accessed by multiple sources and/or several sinks. The modifier volatile is used for some class attributes to avoid cache effects, if various threads read these attributes calling a non-synchronized method. The modifier synchronized is often specified for methods to prevent concurrent method calls, which may lead to inconsistent information, if the internal arrays would simultaneously be changed.

Constructor Detail

AbstractPipe

public AbstractPipe(Source<? extends I>[] sources,
                    int[] sourceIDs)
Helps to create a new pipe as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified sources is fulfilled immediately.

Parameters:
sources - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified sources.
IDs - This pipe uses the given IDs for subscription.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If sources.length != IDs.length.

AbstractPipe

public AbstractPipe(Source<? extends I> source)
Helps to create a new pipe as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately. The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.

AbstractPipe

public AbstractPipe()
No subscriptions will be performed.

process

public void process(I o,
                    int sourceID)
             throws IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: Sink
This method will be called in the transfer method of each source this sink got subscribed to. The element to be transferred will be sent to this sink selecting it as the first paramenter. The second parameter specifies the ID this sink used during its subscription. Therefore, the ID determines from which source this elements is from.
The element should not be cloned if it is transferred to multiple sinks which have been registered by a source. Due to performance reasons this source should rather use the same element and pass it to all subscribed sinks based on the assumption that these sinks will not perform any changes on this element, unless they clone it themselves.

Specified by:
process in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
sourceID - The ID this sink specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

processObject

public abstract void processObject(I o,
                                   int sourceID)
                            throws IllegalArgumentException
This method has to be overwritten to process each incoming element. The transfer method has to be called inside this method to transfer the processing results to all subscribed sinks. Consequently, its execution is considered to be atomar.

Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
ID - One of the IDs this pipe specified during its subscription by the underlying sources.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

Transfers the given element to all subscribed sinks.

transfer in interface Source<O>
Parameters:
o - The element to be transferred.

signalDone

If this pipe is not closed and isDone is true, done is called on all connected sinks.

subscribe

public boolean subscribe(Sink<? super O> sink,
                         int sinkID)
                  throws SourceIsClosedException
Description copied from interface: Source
Subscribes the specified sink with the given ID to this source. The ID is necessary to distinguish different sources when using operators based on multiple inputs.
The sink and its corresponding ID have to be stored in an internal datastructure by this source and each sink can be accessed by an index.

Specified by:
subscribe in interface Source<O>
Parameters:
sink - The sink to be subscribed.
sinkID - The ID which will be passed when transfering a new object to the specified sink.
Returns:
Returns true, if the subscribe operation has been successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

unsubscribe

public boolean unsubscribe(Sink<? super O> sink,
                           int sinkID)
                    throws SourceIsClosedException
Description copied from interface: Source
The given sink cancels its subscription. The registered sink with the given ID will not be informed about new elements any longer. If a sink is subscribed plurally, i.e. the same sink is subscribed with different IDs, only the subscription concerning the specified ID will be removed.

Specified by:
unsubscribe in interface Source<O>
Parameters:
sink - The sink whose subscription is to be cancelled.
sinkID - The ID of the sink whose subscription is to be cancelled.
Returns:
Returns true, if the unsubscribe operation was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

getSinkID

public int getSinkID(Sink<? super O> sink)
              throws SourceIsClosedException,
                     IllegalArgumentException
Returns the ID of the sink, which has initially been specified when the given sink got subscribed to this pipe's source part.
A linear pass through the interal sink array is performed to determine the position of the first matching sink. This position is used to access the internal sinkID array, because during a subscription both arrays are updated at the same position.

Specified by:
getSinkID in interface Source<O>
Parameters:
sink - The sink whose subscription ID should be detected.
Returns:
The first matching ID of the specified sink.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the pipe has already been closed.
IllegalArgumentException - If the specified sink is not subscribed.

getSourceID

public int getSourceID(Source<? extends I> source)
                throws SinkIsDoneException,
                       IllegalArgumentException
Returns the first matching ID this pipe used during its subscription by the specified source. This ID has already been stored, when the addSource method was invoked.
A linear pass through the interal source array is performed to determine the position of the first matching source. This position is used to access the internal sourceID array, because during a subscription both arrays are updated at the same position.

Specified by:
getSourceID in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
source - The source this pipe got subscribed to.
Returns:
The ID this pipe specified during its subscription.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the pipe has already finished its processing.
IllegalArgumentException - If the specified source has not been added.

getSource

public Source<? extends I> getSource(int index)
                              throws SinkIsDoneException,
                                     IllegalArgumentException,
                                     IndexOutOfBoundsException
Returns a reference to the source belonging to the specified index, i.e., the index which was returned for this source when the method addSource was called.
The index corresponds to the source's position in the internal stored array of sources, this pipe got subscribed to.

Specified by:
getSource in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
index - The index used to access sources in the internal array of this pipe.
Returns:
The source belonging to the specified index.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the pipe has already finished its processing.
IllegalArgumentException - If no sources have been added.
IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified index does not exist.

addSource

public boolean addSource(Source<? extends I> source,
                         int sourceID)
                  throws SinkIsDoneException
Similar to the subscribe method, this method establishes a connection between this pipe and a source during runtime. The intention of both methods is to build up a double-linked query graph, which is completely navigatable.
The method should be used to store a reference to the given underlying source together with the ID specified during this pipe's subscription.
The source and the ID used during subscription are stored in internal arrays. Their positions in both arrays are equal.

Specified by:
addSource in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
source - The source this pipe got subscribed to.
ID - The ID this pipe used during its subscription by the specified source.
Returns:
Returns true, if the add operation was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the pipe has already finished its processing.

removeSource

public boolean removeSource(Source<? extends I> source,
                            int sourceID)
                     throws SinkIsDoneException
In conformity to the unsubscribe method, this method removes the connection between this pipe and a source on the pipe's side. Therefore it removes the given source with ID ID from the internal arrays used to store this pipe's references to its sources.

Specified by:
removeSource in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
source - The source this pipe got subscriped to.
ID - The ID this pipe used during its subscription by the specified source.
Returns:
Returns true, if the remove operation was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.
